label: 免田
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 2:  Heian Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1999
説明文: Fields designated to provide dues for temple or shrine that were therefore excused" other taxes so that their tax yield could be forwarded directly to the temple or shrine. Such fields were known as the temple's (or shrine's) "exempt fields" (menden); when different fields each year were designated for this purpose, they were known as "floating exempt fields" (ukimen) (pp. 227-228).  [浮免、浮免田] "
